intro: Melampyrum intermedium, commonly known as yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, woodlands, and roadsides. It produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
